properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the database. This must be unique within a given MySQL server and may or may not be case-sensitive depending on the operating system on which the MySQL server is running.

properties.name: default_character_set
properties.description: • default_character_set - (Optional) The default character set to use when a table is created without specifying an explicit character set. Defaults to "utf8".

properties.name: default_collation
properties.description: • default_collation - (Optional) The default collation to use when a table is created without specifying an explicit collation. Defaults to utf8_general_ci. Each character set has its own set of collations, so changing the character set requires also changing the collation.

Note that the defaults for character set and collation above do not respect any defaults set on the MySQL server, so that the configuration can be set appropriately even though Terraform cannot see the server-level defaults. If you wish to use the server's defaults you must consult the server's configuration and then set the default_character_set and default_collation to match.
Note: MySQL removed the REQUIRE option from GRANT in version 8. tls_option is ignored in MySQL 8 and above.
Note: Attributes role and roles are only supported in MySQL 8 and above.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: user
properties.description: (Optional) The name of the user. Conflicts with role.

properties.name: host
properties.description: (Optional) The source host of the user. Defaults to "localhost". Conflicts with role.

properties.name: role
properties.description: (Optional) The role to grant privileges to. Conflicts with user and host.

properties.name: database
properties.description: (Required) The database to grant privileges on.

properties.name: table
properties.description: (Optional) Which table to grant privileges on. Defaults to *, which is all tables.

properties.name: privileges
properties.description: (Optional) A list of privileges to grant to the user. Refer to a list of privileges (such as here) for applicable privileges. Conflicts with roles.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: (Optional) A list of rols to grant to the user. Conflicts with privileges.

properties.name: tls_option
properties.description: (Optional) An TLS-Option for the GRANT statement. The value is suffixed to REQUIRE. A value of 'SSL' will generate a GRANT ... REQUIRE SSL statement. See the MYSQL GRANT documentation for more. Ignored if MySQL version is under 5.7.0.

properties.name: grant
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to also give the user privileges to grant the same privileges to other users.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the role.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: user
properties.description: (Required) The name of the user.

properties.name: host
properties.description: (Optional) The source host of the user. Defaults to "localhost".

properties.name: plaintext_password
properties.description: (Optional) The password for the user. This must be provided in plain text, so the data source for it must be secured. An unsalted hash of the provided password is stored in state. Conflicts with auth_plugin.

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Optional) Deprecated alias of plaintext_password, whose value is stored as plaintext in state. Prefer to use plaintext_password instead, which stores the password as an unsalted hash. Conflicts with auth_plugin.

properties.name: auth_plugin
properties.description: (Optional) Use an authentication plugin to authenticate the user instead of using password authentication. Description of the fields allowed in the block below. Conflicts with password and plaintext_password.

properties.name: tls_option
properties.description: (Optional) An TLS-Option for the CREATE USER or ALTER USER statement. The value is suffixed to REQUIRE. A value of 'SSL' will generate a CREATE USER ... REQUIRE SSL statement. See the MYSQL CREATE USER documentation for more. Ignored if MySQL version is under 5.7.0.
The auth_plugin value supports:

properties.name: AWSAuthenticationPlugin
properties.description: • AWSAuthenticationPlugin - Allows the use of IAM authentication with Amazon Aurora. For more details on how to use IAM auth with Aurora, see here.

properties.name: mysql_no_login
properties.description: • mysql_no_login - Uses the MySQL No-Login Authentication Plugin. The No-Login Authentication Plugin must be active in MySQL. For more information, see here.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: user
properties.description: (Required) The IAM user to associate with this access key.

properties.name: pgp_key
properties.description: (Required) Either a base-64 encoded PGP public key, or a keybase username in the form keybase:some_person_that_exists.

properties.name: host
properties.description: (Optional) The source host of the user. Defaults to localhost.
